visualization_prompt: Generate a network graph showing linguistic relationships in the Indo-European family using force-directed node positioning
visualization_explanation: The network graph visualizes linguistic relationships through nodes (language groups) and edges (evolutionary connections). Dataset contains 10 nodes (categorical nominal data) and 9 directed edges (ordinal relational data). Synthetic data maintains historical accuracy in branching patterns while introducing color-coded language families. The force-directed layout applies Cairo's principle of natural grouping through physical simulation, with node sizes encoding temporal hierarchy. Tufte's data-ink ratio is maximized through direct labeling and elimination of redundant legend. Color assignment follows perceptual distinctiveness guidelines with HSB color spacing (30° hue intervals). Central node (Proto-Indo-European) uses red (#e74c3c) for pre-attentive pop-out effect, while descendant branches follow categorical color differentiation with luminance consistency (~70 L* value in CIELAB).
